attributes.action: Stop plans to build large row of flats on Beehive Lane communal area.
attributes.additional_details:
1 It is a Fire and safety hazard with two properties being too close to eachother
2 We spend time as a community on this land 
3 Our children play on this small area
4 Very little space here even less space will cause a crowded neighbourhood
5 Noise and building work disruption  
6 Reducing greenery and nature
7 Other areas in Redbridge have larger space to build on
8 It will increase crime and antisocial behaviour in area
9 We need investment in the current buildings that have existed for years
attributes.background: The operational director of housing informing us that they will build new flats opposite beehive court on beehive lane. The communal land is our garden and is where all of us come together as a community. We are signing against this and do not wish for new flats to be built opposite our homes.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
